page.title: 01Impressions of Chobham
page.content: {North west}was mostly woodland of deciduous and evergreen trees with the M3 motorway running through. The remaining{northern}sector was moorland and heath. There were many pylons and as the earth was so dry, no farming took place. To the{west}covered the area around Gracious Pond Road. In this area there are large houses, some dating back hundreds of years, surrounded by deciduous and evergreen trees. To the{south east}was farmland which supported a number of livery stables. Other parts were mixed woodland and a number of ponds. To the {south west}was farmland with some residential housing. The main residential area in the{south}included council housing, private homes and amenities areas such as Burrow Hill green, shops along the Chertsey Road and Windsor Road.
